intro: Palaua micrantha var. hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy palaua, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. This variety is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest undergrowth.
